title: Smallest String With A Given Numeric Value
description: Given an integer 'n' representing a numeric value and an integer 'k' representing the length of the desired string, return the lexicographically smallest string of length 'k' such that the sum of its character values (where 'a' = 1, 'b' = 2, ..., 'z' = 26) equals 'n'. If it is not possible to form such a string, return an empty string.
input_format: Two integers n (1 <= n <= 26 * k) and k (1 <= k <= 100).
output_format: A string of length k that satisfies the conditions, or an empty string if not possible.

examples.explanation: The smallest string with value 10 is 'js' (10 = j(10) + s(19)).
It is not possible to form a string of length 3 that sums to 27, as the maximum character value is 26.
'aaa' is the smallest string possible with value 3.

hints: Start with the smallest characters and adjust based on the remaining value needed.
Ensure to balance character choices to meet the exact sum while maintaining length.
